Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators."},"authorizeOperator(address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-authorizeOperator}."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Returns the amount of tokens owned by an account (`tokenHolder`)."},"borrow(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Function borrow creates a new Loan, moves the USDC to Borrower, and returns the loan ID and fixed Interest Rate   - Also creates an origination fee for the Servicer in HC_Pool","params":{"amount":"The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc).","borrower":"The address of the recipient of the loan","maxRate":"The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc)."}},"burn(uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-burn}. Also emits a {IERC20-Transfer} event for ERC20 compatibility."},"decimals()":{"details":"See {ERC20-decimals}. Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility)."},"defaultOperators()":{"details":"See {IERC777-defaultOperators}."},"getActiveLoans()":{"details":"Function getActiveLoans() returns an array of the loans currently out by users","returns":{"_0":"array of bools, where the index i is the loan ID and the value bool is active or not"}},"getAllLoans()":{"details":"Function getAllLoans() returns an array of the loanIndexes all users have taken out","returns":{"_0":"array on loanIds of loans"}},"getAverageInterest()":{"details":"Function getAverageInterest() returns an average interest for the pool"},"getContractData()":{"details":"Function getContractData() returns a lot of variables about the contract"},"getInterestRate(uint256)":{"details":"Function getInterestRate calculates the new interest rate if a loan was to be taken out in this block","params":{"amount":"The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc)."},"returns":{"_0":"interestRate The interest rate in APR for the loan"}},"getLoanAccruedInterest(uint256)":{"details":"Function getLoanAccruedInterest() calculates and returns the amount of interest accrued on a given loan","params":{"loanId":"is the id for the loan we're looking up"}},"getLoanDetails(uint256)":{"details":"Function getLoanDetails() returns an all the raw details about a loan","params":{"loanId":"is the id for the loan we're looking up"}},"getPoolBorrowed()":{"details":"Function getPoolBorrowed() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)"},"getPoolValueWithInterest()":{"details":"Function getPoolValueWithInterest() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)"},"getServicerAddress()":{"details":"Function getServicerAddress() returns the address of this pool's servicer"},"getSupplyableTokenAddress()":{"details":"Function getSupplyableTokenAddress() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)"},"getUserLoans(address)":{"details":"Function getUserLoans() returns an array of the loanIndexes user has taken out","params":{"user":"is the address for the user we're looking up"}},"granularity()":{"details":"See {IERC777-granularity}. This implementation always returns `1`."},"hasUpgradedFunction()":{"details":"Function hasUpgradedFunction returns bool depending on if contract has been upgraded or not"},"initialize(string,string,address,address,address)":{"details":"Function initialize replaces constructor in upgradable contracts   - Calls the init function of the inherited ERC777 contract","params":{"name":"Name of this particular ERC777 token","symbol":"The ticker this token will go by"}},"isOperatorFor(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-isOperatorFor}."},"lend(uint256)":{"details":"Function lend moves assets on the (probably usdc) contract to our own balance   - Before calling: an approve(address _spender (proxy), uint256 _value (0xffff)) function call must be made on remote contract","params":{"amount":"The amount to be transferred"}},"name()":{"details":"See {IERC777-name}."},"operatorBurn(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-operatorBurn}. Emits {Burned} and {IERC20-Transfer} events."},"operatorSend(address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-operatorSend}. Emits {Sent} and {IERC20-Transfer} events."},"redeem(uint256)":{"details":"Function redeem burns the sender's hcPool tokens and transfers the usdc back to them","params":{"amount":"The amount of hc_pool to be redeemed"}},"repay(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Function repay repays a specific loan   - payment is first deducted from the interest then principal.    - the servicer_fee is deducted from the interest repayment and servicer is compensated in hc_pool   - repayer must have first approved fromsfers on behalf ","params":{"amount":"The amount of the ERC20 token to repay the loan with","loanId":"The loan to be repayed"}},"revokeOperator(address)":{"details":"See {IERC777-revokeOperator}."},"send(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See {IERC777-send}. Also emits a {IERC20-Transfer} event for ERC20 compatibility."},"setApprovedAddresses(address[])":{"details":"Function setApprovedAddresses() updates the array of addresses approved by the servicer","params":{"_servicerAddresses":"The array of addresses to be set as approved for borrowing"}},"symbol()":{"details":"See {IERC777-symbol}."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC777-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface if it is a contract. Also emits a {Sent} event."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators). Emits {Sent}, {IERC20-Transfer} and {IERC20-Approval} documentation.text: @dev Function hasUpgradedFunction returns bool depending on if contract has been upgraded or not

allowance(address,address).details: See {IERC20-allowance}. Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by an account (`tokenHolder`).

borrow(uint256,address,uint256).details: Function borrow creates a new Loan, moves the USDC to Borrower, and returns the loan ID and fixed Interest Rate   - Also creates an origination fee for the Servicer in HC_Pool

params.amount: The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc).
params.borrower: The address of the recipient of the loan
params.maxRate: The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc).

burn(uint256,bytes).details: See {IERC777-burn}. Also emits a {IERC20-Transfer} event for ERC20 compatibility.

decimals().details: See {ERC20-decimals}. Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility).

getActiveLoans().details: Function getActiveLoans() returns an array of the loans currently out by users

returns._0: array of bools, where the index i is the loan ID and the value bool is active or not

getAllLoans().details: Function getAllLoans() returns an array of the loanIndexes all users have taken out

getAverageInterest().details: Function getAverageInterest() returns an average interest for the pool

getContractData().details: Function getContractData() returns a lot of variables about the contract

getInterestRate(uint256).details: Function getInterestRate calculates the new interest rate if a loan was to be taken out in this block

params.amount: The size of the potential loan in (probably usdc).

returns._0: interestRate The interest rate in APR for the loan

getLoanAccruedInterest(uint256).details: Function getLoanAccruedInterest() calculates and returns the amount of interest accrued on a given loan

params.loanId: is the id for the loan we're looking up

getLoanDetails(uint256).details: Function getLoanDetails() returns an all the raw details about a loan

params.loanId: is the id for the loan we're looking up

getPoolBorrowed().details: Function getPoolBorrowed() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)

getPoolValueWithInterest().details: Function getPoolValueWithInterest() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)

getServicerAddress().details: Function getServicerAddress() returns the address of this pool's servicer

getSupplyableTokenAddress().details: Function getSupplyableTokenAddress() returns the contract address of ERC20 this pool accepts (ususally USDC)

getUserLoans(address).details: Function getUserLoans() returns an array of the loanIndexes user has taken out

params.user: is the address for the user we're looking up

hasUpgradedFunction().details: Function hasUpgradedFunction returns bool depending on if contract has been upgraded or not

initialize(string,string,address,address.details: Function initialize replaces constructor in upgradable contracts   - Calls the init function of the inherited ERC777 contract

params.name: Name of this particular ERC777 token
params.symbol: The ticker this token will go by

lend(uint256).details: Function lend moves assets on the (probably usdc) contract to our own balance   - Before calling: an approve(address _spender (proxy), uint256 _value (0xffff)) function call must be made on remote contract

redeem(uint256).details: Function redeem burns the sender's hcPool tokens and transfers the usdc back to them

params.amount: The amount of hc_pool to be redeemed

repay(uint256,uint256).details: Function repay repays a specific loan   - payment is first deducted from the interest then principal.    - the servicer_fee is deducted from the interest repayment and servicer is compensated in hc_pool   - repayer must have first approved fromsfers on behalf

params.amount: The amount of the ERC20 token to repay the loan with

send(address,uint256,bytes).details: See {IERC777-send}. Also emits a {IERC20-Transfer} event for ERC20 compatibility.

setApprovedAddresses(address[]).details: Function setApprovedAddresses() updates the array of addresses approved by the servicer

params._servicerAddresses: The array of addresses to be set as approved for borrowing

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the {IERC777Recipient} interface if it is a contract. Also emits a {Sent} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators). Emits {Sent}, {IERC20-Transfer} and {IERC20-Approval} events.
